results.title: Energy in perspective
results.creator_credit: Peter De Normanville, Douglas Gordon and Balfour Films
results.brief_description: Looks at the history of energy sources, the effect the industrial revolution had on the use of energy in all forms, its increasing use today, the need for conservation of power sources and the research being undertaken today in all parts of the world into new sources of energy
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter De Normanville, Douglas Gordon and Balfour Films
results.description: Looks at the history of energy sources, the effect the industrial revolution had on the use of energy in all forms, its increasing use today, the need for conservation of power sources and the research being undertaken today in all parts of the world into new sources of energy

results.title: Chemical reactions I
results.creator_credit: Barrie Whatley, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: Discusses the vibration and dissociation of a diatomic molecule. From these simple systems the theoretical ideas that are used to discuss the role of energy in chemical reactions are developed.

results.title: Energy highway
results.creator_credit: Dennis Hill Productions, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: This film shows the construction of a natural gas pipeline stretching half way across Australia. Made for the Pipeline Authority, this film shows the immensity of the task and the people involved in achieving this feat

results.title: Energy for the future
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Examines energy alternatives for the future, including processed coal, shale oil, geothermal heat, nuclear fission and fusion, wind and solar heat. Many of these sources already supply part of our country’s energy needs - but some with accompanying social and environmental consequences
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: The Energy crunch: the nuclear dilemma
results.creator_credit: Patrick Uden, Lawrence Wade and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: Explores the possibility of using nuclear energy for the safe production of electricity. Shows the increasing demand for power that cannot be met by the current available resources. States the potential dangers involved in switching to nuclear power
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patrick Uden, Lawrence Wade and British Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: The Energy carol
results.creator_credit: Les Drew, Sidney Goldsmith, Wolf Koenig, Conservation and Renewable Energy Branch, Energy, Mines and Resources Canada and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated film dealing with conservation of energy resources. Ebenezer Scrooge has a motto: to waste is to grow. His motto becomes: back to basics. “The Energy carol” traces this momentous transformation, and introduces us to the spirits of energy past, present and future (Award: New York)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Les Drew, Sidney Goldsmith, Wolf Koenig, Conservation and Renewable Energy Branch, Energy, Mines and Resources Canada and National Film Board of Canada
results.description: An animated film dealing with conservation of energy resources. Ebenezer Scrooge has a motto: to waste is to grow. results.title: Energy and matter
results.creator_credit: Robert Verrall, Joseph Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A look at energy and what it is, designed to encourage understanding and experimentation among even the youngest of budding physicists. This film pictures energy in familiar forms - light, heat, motion, etc. - and shows its origin in the sun. The illustration is cartoon-style, with color and movement appealing to youthful imaginations.

results.title: Energy and agriculture
results.creator_credit: Chris Oliver, Nicholas Alexander and CSIRO
results.brief_description: Suggests ways of cutting down on energy use in agriculture. Shows how technological change and scientific research can expand the man-on-the-land’s role of producing food energy to the production of liquid fuels such as methanol and ethanol.
results.description: Suggests ways of cutting down on energy use in agriculture. Shows how technological change and scientific research can expand the man-on-the-land’s role of producing food energy to the production of liquid fuels such as methanol and ethanol.

results.title: Energetics of life
results.creator_credit: Mallory Pearce, Daniel E. Atkinson, E.A. Carlson and FilmFair Communications
results.brief_description: Treats the types and functions of energy in living things - kinetic and potential energy; thermodynamics; free energy and chemical energy. Described in detail are the structure and function of the ATP molecule; photosynthesis; the metabolism of glucose. Emphasizes the ability of the ATP molecule to harness solar energy and use it
